thread.title: Why Central Banks’ Dominion Over Markets Is Here to Stay

author: Jon Sindreu
title: Why Central Banks’ Dominion Over Markets Is Here to Stay
text:
Ten-year Treasury yields’ rise above 3% for the first time in four years last week confirmed the end of a decade of unprecedented monetary stimulus. But central banks’ vast power over markets may not be over.
A big chunk of this power has stemmed from how central banks have painstakingly communicated their every intention to investors, analysts say. There are few signs of this approach changing.
